title: U.S. Presses Partners to Weed Out Illicit Trade With Russia
description: American officials worry that commercial activities in Turkey and the United Arab Emirates could be fueling Russia’s war machine and have threatened to punish those involved.

title: Russia Pushes to Take Ukrainian Town Near a Vital Supply Line
description: Ukraine has used the strategic town of Vuhledar to launch attacks disrupting transit on a critical rail link between the war’s southern and eastern fronts.

title: U.S. Sends Longer-Range Weapons
description: The latest aid package will allow Ukraine to hit targets 90 miles away.

title: What Weapons Is Ukraine Getting, and Will They Arrive in Time?
description: Kyiv has been promised scores of tanks and other armor, and the longest range munitions yet. But with a looming Russian offensive, a race is on to get the matériel to the battlefield.

title: At Czech Spa Town, ‘Russia for Us Is the Past, and It Was Not Pleasant’
description: Since the 18th century, Russians have flocked to the healing waters of Karlovy Vary. Now, the Czech government has barred them from visiting the country, and the town must reinvent itself.

title: Your Friday Briefing: The U.S. Military Expands in the Philippines
description: Also, Vladimir Putin evokes Stalingrad and a contested film is a box-office hit in India.

title: Deadly Russian Attack Destroys Kramatorsk Apartment
description: Rescue crews helped injured and trapped civilians in the industrial Ukrainian city of Kramatorsk, which has been the site of frequent attacks since Russia’s invasion.

title: Has the Russian Offensive Begun?
description: Ukraine is bracing for a major escalation in the Donbas.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Rising Militancy in Pakistan
description: Also, Adani Enterprises pulls its offering and soldiers die on both sides in Bakhmut.

description: Also, Russia’s resilient economy and Sri Lanka’s enduring struggle.

title: U.S. Sends Longer-Range Weapons
author: Carole Landry
description: The latest aid package will allow Ukraine to hit targets 90 miles away.

title: What Weapons Is Ukraine Getting, and Will They Arrive in Time?
author: Lara Jakes
description: Kyiv has been promised scores of tanks and other armor, and the longest range munitions yet. But with a looming Russian offensive, a race is on to get the matériel to the battlefield.

title: At Czech Spa Town, ‘Russia for Us Is the Past, and It Was Not Pleasant’
author: Andrew Higgins
description: Since the 18th century, Russians have flocked to the healing waters of Karlovy Vary. Now, the Czech government has barred them from visiting the country, and the town must reinvent itself.

title: Your Friday Briefing: The U.S. Military Expands in the Philippines
author: Amelia Nierenberg
description: Also, Vladimir Putin evokes Stalingrad and a contested film is a box-office hit in India.

title: Deadly Russian Attack Destroys Kramatorsk Apartment
author: Reuters
description: Rescue crews helped injured and trapped civilians in the industrial Ukrainian city of Kramatorsk, which has been the site of frequent attacks since Russia’s invasion.

title: Has the Russian Offensive Begun?
author: Carole Landry
description: Ukraine is bracing for a major escalation in the Donbas.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Rising Militancy in Pakistan
author: Amelia Nierenberg
description: Also, Adani Enterprises pulls its offering and soldiers die on both sides in Bakhmut.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: China Rebounds
author: Amelia Nierenberg
description: Also, Russia’s resilient economy and Sri Lanka’s enduring struggle.

title: U.S. Presses Partners to Weed Out Illicit Trade With Russia
author: Ben Hubbard
description: American officials worry that commercial activities in Turkey and the United Arab Emirates could be fueling Russia’s war machine and have threatened to punish those involved.
